page.title: 13*MART DAY IN THE VILLAGE**
page.content: One Saturday six children went to the mart to do a questionnaire for the Domesday Project.We found out that the mart started over 100 years ago and sold only large and small livestock.Farmers came in their pony traps and carts. The boys used to hold the horses for a penny.The mart is now so popular that it is open twice a month.Now it sells many things.Some of them are poultry, goats, bikes, household things and logs.People came from long distances and local places.On the day of our survey the longest distance was from Darlington.We noticed that young people were not as interested in answering our questions as the older ones.The people over 50 helped a lot.On mart Saturdays there were cars everywhere.At other times the mart square is quiet.
